intro: Uragoga mansoana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 centimeters and prefers bright, indirect light. Its foliage is often velvety and comes in shades of green, purple, and silver. Uragoga mansoana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
